comments.body:
Actually, can you double check if this line is necessary?
When I first implemented this logic, we didn't have any plugin args' defaults. I'm wondering if the machinery already handles the defaulting somewhere else.

You would know if it works if, after removing this line, the scheme_tests.go pass (like the test case `empty and no plugin args`).
the tests fail if I comment this out.

We should stop doing this in v1beta2 #97048. Same below.

I thought a previous version of this PR already had changed this.

Better do a second pass over the list in #95446

No, what we wanted to stop doing was this:

https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/5b46064cae41395cf775cb445ffdaae1261076c7/pkg/scheduler/apis/config/v1beta1/defaults.go#L79-L82

The else clause in this PR is there so that plain IPs are allowed in addition to IP:port. We no longer allow inputs that are both invalid IP and invalid IP:port, which is what that issue is talking about.

I'll update the release note and mark the completed items in a bit.
ahh, it was the next else. Sorry :)
Do we have a unit test for this last condition since this was changed from v1beta1?
good catch, added a test (see "metrics and healthz with invalid IP" in defaults_test.go)
